head.title: Interpublic Unit Gives 3 Executives New Jobs

hedline.hl1: Interpublic Unit Gives 3 Executives New Jobs

abstract.p: Initiative Media North America names Carolyn Bivens managing director for Western region; Jim Bell is named managing director for entire Eastern region; Lawrence B Orell is named executive vice president and general manager at New York office (Advertising column) (S)

block.p: Initiative Media North America, part of the Initiative Media Worldwide unit of the Interpublic Group of Companies, said yesterday that it had named three executives to new posts.

Carolyn Bivens, 47, was named managing director for the Western region, based in Los Angeles. She had been senior vice president and associate publisher at USA Today in Arlington, Va., which is owned by the Gannett Company.
Initiative Media North America, part of the Initiative Media Worldwide unit of the Interpublic Group of Companies, said yesterday that it had named three executives to new posts.

Carolyn Bivens, 47, was named managing director for the Western region, based in Los Angeles. She had been senior vice president and associate publisher at USA Today in Arlington, Va., which is owned by the Gannett Company.
Jim Bell, 51, managing director for the Northeast region in New York, was named managing director for the entire Eastern region.

And Lawrence B. Orell, 43, was named executive vice president and general manager at the New York office. He had been executive vice president and general manager at the Lord Group in New York, a joint venture of Dentsu Inc. and Young & Rubicam Inc.
